recipe_name: Griddled steak burger with chilli relish
author: James Tanner
method: For the burger, place the steak, onion, garlic and chilli in a food processor and pulse until minced. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and shape into a patty. Dredge the burger in the flour. Heat one tablespoon of the olive oil in a non-stick frying pan and fry the burger for 3-4 minutes, or until cooked through. Drizzle the cut sides of the baguette with the remaining oil and fry, oiled-side down, until lightly toasted, pressing down with a spatula if necessary. For the relish, heat the oil in a small saucepan and fry the pepper and chilli together for 2-3 minutes, or until the pepper starts to soften. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 4-5 minutes. To serve, place the burger inside the baguette, sprinkle with cheese and top with a dollop of relish.
ingredients: 150g/5½oz steak, trimmed of fat and roughly chopped,  ¼ onion, chopped,  1 garlic clove, crushed,  ½ red or green chilli,  salt and freshly ground black pepper ,  1 tbsp plain flour,  2 tbsp olive oil,  baguette, split open,  30g/1oz emmental cheese, grated, to serve,  1 tbsp olive oil,  ¼ Romero pepper, chopped,  ¼ red or green chilli, chopped,  1 tbsp red wine vinegar,  1 tsp caster sugar,  1 tbsp honey,  1 tsp lime juice
